title: Kazakhstan’s Former Security Chief Is Detained on Treason Charges
sub_head: State television reports that protests are subsiding after days of clashes between troops and demonstrators
body:
MOSCOW—Authorities in Kazakhstan detained the former head of the Central Asian country’s domestic security agency and other officials, saying they were suspected of treason, as government forces, backed by Russian troops, sought to restore order after days of unrest.
More than 4,400 people, including an undisclosed number of foreign citizens, have been detained, according to the Kazakh Interior Ministry, in connection with at-times violent antigovernment protests venting popular frustration with the economy and closely controlled political system.
